newsitem.title: FRANCE: Stabbed French minister discharged from hospital.
newsitem.headline: Stabbed French minister discharged from hospital.

text.p: French Culture Minister Philippe Douste-Blazy, stabbed in the back last week during a campaign swing, was discharged from hospital on Tuesday but needs more time to convalesce, hospital officials said.
Aides whisked away Douste-Blazy to an undisclosed location where he could recover in peace from a stab wound to the lung and two broken ribs, the officials said.

Douste-Blazy was attacked last Friday while campaigning in his constituency in the Catholic shrine of Lourdes, southwest France. France is preparing for a two-round parliamentary election on May 25 and June 1.
A 37-year-old man of Albanian origin, Adlal Cifti, has been placed under investigation for attempted first degree murder in connection with the knifing but has denied guilt.
Cifti, who was under psychiatric treatment, had already attacked Douste-Blazy with a screwdriver in 1992.
